About Us - The Hartsprings Foundation Skip to content Search for: Home About Us What to Donate Where To Donate Ways to Help Host a Donation Bin or Box Contact Us CALL (888) 413-2227 Schedule a FREE Pickup Search for: About Us Home About Us About Us pressable@alias-solutions.com 2025-04-03T16:08:34-04:00 About Us We were founded in 1997 with the purposes of funding Big Brothers Big Sisters mentoring programs in Massachusetts and Connecticut. Hartsprings Foundation collects used, unwanted clothing and small household items and thanks to our partnership with Savers thrift stores, you can support Hartsprings Foundation by donating gently used clothing and small household items you no longer need at specified Savers locations. Savers purchases the donated goods from Hartsprings, providing us with revenue to continue our collection efforts and providing funding for our non-profit partners. To date, Hartsprings has generated millions of dollars in funding for these agencies. As of October 2023, our financial support has been dedicated to Big Brothers Big Sisters in Western Massachusetts and all of Connecticut. Big Brothers Big Sisters programs match local at-risk children with a volunteer Big Brothers or Big Sisters mentor through community-based and school-based programs. Research has found that Little Brothers and Sisters who participate are: 46% less likely to start using drugs 27% less likely to start drinking 52% less likely to skip a day of school More confident in their schoolwork Get along better with their families In addition, your donations to Hartsprings also help to protect and preserve our environment, keeping more than 5 million pounds of clothing and small household items out of local landfills each year. How you can help Schedule a donation pickup Drop off your donation Organize a neighborhood collection day Host a donation bin Place a collection box at your business Partners Copyright 2016 Hartsprings Foundation, 266 Cold Spring Ave., West Springfield, MA All Rights Reserved | Powered by alias | solutions Page load link Go to Top

 (Travel Trailer) Overall Rating There really isn't a whole lot to say about Hart Springs Park.  It is clean, the sites are relatively spacious, the campground is relatively small and if I had kids with me, I would pick sites in the middle of the campground instead of around the edge of the campground, as your campsite would back into the field and it becomes a really... more There really isn't a whole lot to say about Hart Springs Park.  It is clean, the sites are relatively spacious, the campground is relatively small and if I had kids with me, I would pick sites in the middle of the campground instead of around the edge of the campground, as your campsite would back into the field and it becomes a really large playground for them. The springs itself is about a 5 - 10 min walk away and is paved.  Along the way, there are 4 other marked trails, which I gather from our walk is hardly used, as a good sections of these are overgrown, so you need to be looking for the trail blaze.  (Travel Trailer) Overall Rating We camped with friends in June and had a great time. The campground checkin process was lengthy, with a long list of rules and an emphasis on the no alcohol limitation (not observed by everyone). The sites are large and spacious and each have an old picnic table and fire ring. There are a lot of ants everywhere, so keep that in mind an... more We camped with friends in June and had a great time. The campground checkin process was lengthy, with a long list of rules and an emphasis on the no alcohol limitation (not observed by everyone). The sites are large and spacious and each have an old picnic table and fire ring. There are a lot of ants everywhere, so keep that in mind and watch where you walk. There is a short trail that leads down to the springs, which are open an extra our earlier/later for the campground residents in addition to the normal 9:00am - 7:30pm. We enjoyed the quieter hours after everyone else had left and sometimes found ourselves completely alone in the spring. Keep in mind that the forested trail leading to the springs is loaded with mosquitoes and I wouldn't suggest doing it on foot (we biked several times and still got eaten alive). Another thing to keep in mind is that the spring will close often if the river level rises (after periods of heavy rain), in which case you can still visit other springs in the area that are not as close to the river. The AT&T cell reception was hit or miss and it was a struggle to work with the data connection. All in all we enjoyed our stay here and would come back again.  (Toy Hauler Fifth Wheel) Overall Rating We stayed for two weeks in January 2022 and then ended up extending our reservation by an extra 6 nights to stay 20 nights in total. We made a driving tour of the campground located here:  https://youtu.be/ftXgR7K8gPk. 

What a hidden gem! We booked Hart Springs because of its access to the natural spring, and we were overjoyed to fi... more We stayed for two weeks in January 2022 and then ended up extending our reservation by an extra 6 nights to stay 20 nights in total. We made a driving tour of the campground located here:  https://youtu.be/ftXgR7K8gPk. What a hidden gem! We booked Hart Springs because of its access to the natural spring, and we were overjoyed to find this amazing little park was more than we had hoped. Quiet, clean, and secure with so much space between sites. We thoroughly enjoyed the paved trail to the natural spring and the hiking trails on property. The camp hosts were very helpful, and the arrival/check-in process was super easy. Do pay attention to the route your GPS recommends you take. Our RV GPS tried to send us down a sand/dirt road right across from the country road the park is located on. Cell service was pretty spotty -- ATT seemed to be better than Verizon. Having a good wifi system in our rig helped overcome limited TV channels. The positives far outweigh any negatives here, though. We would definitely stay again! Pros: -- the amount of space between you and your neighbors is insane! -- 50 amp, full hook up (majority of the sites, can't confirm all of them) -- clean, quiet, and secure! -- easy online reservations -- paved walking/bicycle trail to the Hart Springs county park with an incredible natural spring and swimming area -- hiking trails (well-marked, well-maintained) -- amazing night sky views and owls galore! -- boardwalk along the Suwanee River -- helpful camp hosts -- able to receive packages at the campground Cons: -- Cell phone service is a bit of a challenge (Our Pepwave Max Transit Duo system worked well, as did our ATT Netgear Nighthawk), but our cell phones (Verizon) would lose service just outside of the park. -- Does require about a 15 minute drive to any restaurant or store ~Chris and Jody, Porter's Pilgrimage Access Location Cleanliness Site Quality Noise AT&T 5G Verizon 5G Chris and Jody would stay here again Helpful 0 This review is the opinion of a Campendium member and not of Campendium.com Bones 6 reviews “Nice place” Reviewed 11/27/2020 Days stayed: 3 Site Number: 69 Overall Rating It's a smaller park with one main shower area surrounded by a big common area in the middle with basket ball court, swings and shuffle board. This is a wonderful little campground, ran by the city/county.  The camp host (Kristy) is the sweetest person.  The property is very well maintained and the springs are beautiful.  It's not close to a lot (we go down to serve at a local horse rescue), but if you need to be in the area (or is you want to visit a park with springs)... this place is wonderful.  The Burger Spot in Bell had fantastic onion rings so, double bonus!  Property does have some big rig friendly sites and the road is easy to navigate. Good Sam discount and weekly discount:  both are available.
